comments:
Looking at bug 81329, I added support to sort members inside enum declarations.
But on the test case in
org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model.SortCompilationUnitElementsTests.test024, I end
up with:
org.eclipse.text.edits.MalformedTreeException: Range of child edit lies outside

It does work if I change the code a bit. So I believe this is a bug in the
ASTRewriteAnalyzer and not in the SortElementOperation.
Let me know if you believe the problem comes from the SortElementOperation.
Once this is fixed, the UI should enable again sorting inside enums.

Take latest out of HEAD and enable test024 in
org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.model.SortCompilationUnitElementsTests. Then run that
test to see the problem.

The constants have wrong source ranges:
- open in the AST view and drill down to the two constants:
  they both have a length that goes up to the method bar()

Fixed and released in HEAD.
Regression test added in ASTConverter15Test.test0150
*** Bug 88220 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message: Range of child edit lies outside of parent edit
